Long told that they were safe from computer viruses and malware attacks, Apple users last month fell victim to the largest-scale malware attack on Macs to date. Security experts now estimate that the malware made cyber criminals $10,000 a day.
abstract: Long told that they were safe from computer viruses and malware attacks, Apple users last month fell victim to the largest-scale malware attack on Macs to date. Security experts now estimate that the malware made cyber criminals $10,000 a day.

headline.main: Malware for Macs Lucrative, Security Researchers Say

snippet: Attracted by Pandora's popularity and the way it handles music licenses, many online music services have developed similar services.
abstract: Attracted by Pandora's popularity and the way it handles music licenses, many online music services have developed similar services.

headline.main: Pandora's Siren Song: Imitators Want Its Audience, but Not Its Losses

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes surging interest in online casino games as a result of the Justice Department's new take on online gambling, a ...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes surging interest in online casino games as a result of the Justice Department's new take on online gambling, a look at Facebook's organ donor status updates and Kickstarter projects that didn't do so well.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Apple Security and Kickstarter Flops

snippet: Microsoft rarely makes its own hardware, preferring instead to make the software that powers devices made by other companies. The company's decision to invest in the Nook e-book business of the struggling retailer Barnes & Noble offers some tantal...
abstract: Microsoft rarely makes its own hardware, preferring instead to make the software that powers devices made by other companies. The company's decision to invest in the Nook e-book business of the struggling retailer Barnes & Noble offers some tantalizing clues that Microsoft may be rethinking its position on hardware, though.

headline.main: With Nook Deal, a Hint of Microsoft Hardware

snippet: Now that Research in Motion has demonstrated its new BlackBerry 10 software, the big question for third-party software makers is whether they will invest in developing apps for the struggling BlackBerry maker.
abstract: Now that Research in Motion has demonstrated its new BlackBerry 10 software, the big question for third-party software makers is whether they will invest in developing apps for the struggling BlackBerry maker.

headline.main: Developers Have Mixed Reactions to BlackBerry 10 News

snippet: Shares rose after data on the manufacturing sector offered evidence of a faster economic recovery.
abstract: Shares rise after data on the manufacturing sector offers evidence of a faster economic recovery than expected, easing anxiety about a slowdown.

headline.main: Blue Chips Lead the Way As Major Indexes Close Higher
headline.print_headline: Blue Chips Lead the Way As Major Indexes Close Higher

snippet: The BlackBerry 10 is critical to the revival of Research in Motion, but early models given to app developers were missing features, like the ability to make calls.
abstract: Research in Motion unveils prototypes of the new BlackBerry 10 smartphone and has staked its future on hardware and software innovations; demonstrations raise concerns, however, as early models given to app developers are missing important features, like the ability to make calls.

headline.main: BlackBerry 10 Prototype Is Given to Developers
headline.print_headline: BlackBerry 10 Prototype Is Given to Developers

snippet: Mallory Kievman is building a company to market her cure for hiccups.
